org.apache.hama.graph

Class AggregationRunner<V extends org.apache.hadoop.io.WritableComparable,E extends org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable,M extends org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hama.graph.AggregationRunner<V,E,M>

  • public final class AggregationRunner<V extends org.apache.hadoop.io.WritableComparable,E extends org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable,M extends org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable>
extends Object
    Runner class to do the tasks that need to be done if aggregation was configured.

      The method the master task does, it globally aggregates the values of each peer and updates the given map accordingly.

      Runs the aggregators by sending their values to the master task.

        public void aggregateVertex(int index,
                            M lastValue,

        Aggregates the last value before computation and the value after the computation.
        Parameters:
        lastValue - the value before compute().
        value - the vertex.

      • doMasterAggregation

        public void doMasterAggregation(org.apache.hadoop.io.MapWritable updatedCnt)
        The method the master task does, it globally aggregates the values of each peer and updates the given map accordingly.

      • receiveAggregatedValues

        public boolean receiveAggregatedValues(org.apache.hadoop.io.MapWritable updatedValues,
                                       long iteration)
                                throws IOException,
                                       SyncException,
                                       InterruptedException
        Receives aggregated values from a master task.
        Returns:
        always true if no aggregators are defined, false if aggregators say we haven't seen any messages anymore.
        Throws:
        IOException
        SyncException
        InterruptedException

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Returns:
        true if aggregators were defined. Normally used by the internal stateful methods, outside shouldn't use it too extensively.

      • masterReadAggregatedValue
